column4: is my deleting dyntax correct? I'm trying to delete a bunch of jpg files with the command
is my deleting dyntax correct? I'm trying to delete a bunch of jpg files with the command "rm -rf *.jpg" but when I do "ls -R | grep jpg" afterwards it still finds files
your rm command is only deleting jpgs in the present dir, but you ls -R is showing jpgs recursively in sub dirs
check the faq at #bash, this question is answered
